column2: And yet, as I looked from face to face, calm, grave, wise, wholly unafraid, evidently assured and determined, I had the funniest feeling--a very early feeling--a feeling that I traced back and back in memory until I caught up with it at last.
column3: And yet, as I looked from face to face, calm, grave, wise, wholly unafraid, evidently assured and determined, I had the funniest feeling-a very early feeling-a feeling that I traced back and back in memory until I caught up with it at last.

column2: It was that sense of being hopelessly in the wrong that I had so often felt in early youth when my short legs' utmost effort failed to overcome the fact that I was late to school.
column3: It was that sense of being hopelessly in the wrong that I had so often felt in early youth when my short legs' utmost effort failed to overcome the fact that I was late to school.

column2: Jeff felt it too; I could see he did.
column3: Jeff felt it too; I could see he did.

column2: We felt like small boys, very small boys, caught doing mischief in some gracious lady's house.
column3: We felt like small boys, very small boys, caught doing mischief in some gracious lady's house.

column2: But Terry showed no such consciousness.
column3: But Terry showed no such consciousness.

column2: I saw his quick eyes darting here and there, estimating numbers, measuring distances, judging chances of escape.
column3: I saw his quick eyes darting here and there, estimating numbers, measuring distances, judging chances of escape.

column2: He examined the close ranks about us, reaching back far on every side, and murmured softly to me, "Every one of 'em over forty as I'm a sinner."
column3: He examined the close ranks about us, reaching back far on every side, and murmured softly to me, "Every one of 'em over forty as I'm a sinner."

column2: Yet they were not old women.
column3: Yet they were not old women.

column2: Each was in the full bloom of rosy health, erect, serene, standing sure-footed and light as any pugilist.
column3: Each was in the full bloom of rosy health, erect, serene, standing sure footed and light as any pugilist.

column2: They had no weapons, and we had, but we had no wish to shoot.
column3: They had no weapons, and we had, but we had no wish to shoot.

column2: I'd as soon shoot my aunts, muttered Terry again.
column3: I'd as soon shoot my aunts, muttered Terry again.

column2: What do they want with us anyhow?	What do they want with us anyhow?

column2: They seem to mean business." But in spite of that businesslike aspect, he determined to try his favorite tactics.
column3: They seem to mean business." But in spite of that businesslike aspect, he determined to try his favorite tactics.

column2: Terry had come armed with a theory.
column3: Terry had come armed with a theory.

column2: He stepped forward, with his brilliant ingratiating smile, and made low obeisance to the women before him.
column3: He stepped forward, with his brilliant ingratiating smile, and made low obeisance to the women before him.

column2: Then he produced another tribute, a broad soft scarf of filmy texture, rich in color and pattern, a lovely thing, even to my eye, and offered it with a deep bow to the tall unsmiling woman who seemed to head the ranks before him.
column3: Then he produced another tribute, a broad soft scarf of filmy texture, rich in color and pattern, a lovely thing, even to my eye, and offered it with a deep bow to the tall unsmiling woman who seemed to head the ranks before him.

column2: She took it with a gracious nod of acknowledgment, and passed it on to those behind her.
column3: She took it with a gracious nod of acknowledgment, and passed it on to those behind her.

column2: He tried again, this time bringing out a circlet of rhinestones, a glittering crown that should have pleased any woman on earth.
column3: He tried again, this time bringing out a circlet of rhinestones, a glittering crown that should have pleased any woman on earth.

column2: He made a brief address, including Jeff and me as partners in his enterprise, and with another bow presented this.
column3: He made a brief address, including Jeff and me as partners in his enterprise, and with another bow presented this.

column2: Again his gift was accepted and, as before, passed out of sight.
column3: Again his gift was accepted and, as before, passed out of sight.

column2: If they were only younger, he muttered between his teeth.
column3: If they were only younger, he muttered between his teeth.

column2: What on earth is a fellow to say to a regiment of old Colonels like this?
column3: What on earth is a fellow to say to a regiment of old Colonels like this?

column2: In all our discussions and speculations we had always unconsciously assumed that the women, whatever else they might be, would be young. Most men do think that way, I fancy.
column3: In all our discussions and speculations we had always unconsciously assumed that the women, whatever else they might be, would be young. Most men do think that way, I fancy.

column2: Woman in the abstract is young, and, we assume, charming.
column3: Woman in the abstract is young, and, we assume, charming.

column2: As they get older they pass off the stage, somehow, into private ownership mostly, or out of it altogether.
column3: As they get older they pass off the stage, somehow, into private ownership mostly, or out of it altogether.

column2: But these good ladies were very much on the stage, and yet any one of them might have been a grandmother.
column3: But these good ladies were very much on the stage, and yet any one of them might have been a grandmother.

column2: We looked for nervousness--there was none.
column3: We looked for nervousness-there was none.

column2: For terror, perhaps--there was none.
column3: For terror, perhaps-there was none.

column2: For uneasiness, for curiosity, for excitement--and all we saw was what might have been a vigilance committee of women doctors, as cool as cucumbers, and evidently meaning to take us to task for being there.
column3: For uneasiness, for curiosity, for excitement-and all we saw was what might have been a vigilance committee of women doctors, as cool as cucumbers, and evidently meaning to take us to task for being there.

column2: Six of them stepped forward now, one on either side of each of us, and indicated that we were to go with them.
column3: Six of them stepped forward now, one on either side of each of us, and indicated that we were to go with them.

column2: We thought it best to accede, at first anyway, and marched along, one of these close at each elbow, and the others in close masses before, behind, on both sides.
column3: We thought it best to accede, at first anyway, and marched along, one of these close at each elbow, and the others in close masses before, behind, on both sides.

column2: A large building opened before us, a very heavy thick-walled impressive place, big, and old-looking; of gray stone, not like the rest of the town.
column3: A large building opened before us, a very heavy thick walled impressive place, big, and old looking; of gray stone, not like the rest of the town.

column2: This won't do! said Terry to us, quickly.
column3: This won't do! said Terry to us, quickly.

column2: We mustn't let them get us in this, boys.	We mustn't let them get us in this, boys.

column2: All together, now--"
column3: All together, now-"

column2: We stopped in our tracks.
column3: We stopped in our tracks.

column2: We began to explain, to make signs pointing away toward the big forest--indicating that we would go back to it--at once.
column3: We began to explain, to make signs pointing away toward the big forest-indicating that we would go back to it-at once.

column2: It makes me laugh, knowing all I do now, to think of us three boys--nothing else; three audacious impertinent boys--butting into an unknown country without any sort of a guard or defense.
column3: It makes me laugh, knowing all I do now, to think of us three boys-nothing else; three audacious impertinent boys-butting into an unknown country without any sort of a guard or defense.

column2: We seemed to think that if there were men we could fight them, and if there were only women--why, they would be no obstacles at all.
column3: We seemed to think that if there were men we could fight them, and if there were only women-why, they would be no obstacles at all.

column2: Jeff, with his gentle romantic old-fashioned notions of women as clinging vines.
column3: Jeff, with his gentle romantic old-fashioned notions of women as clinging vines.

column2: Terry, with his clear decided practical theories that there were two kinds of women--those he wanted and those he didn't; Desirable and Undesirable was his demarcation.
column3: Terry, with his clear decided practical theories that there were two kinds of women-those he wanted and those he didn't; Desirable and Undesirable was his demarcation.

column2: The latter as a large class, but negligible--he had never thought about them at all.
column3: The latter as a large class, but negligible-he had never thought about them at all.

column2: And now here they were, in great numbers, evidently indifferent to what he might think, evidently determined on some purpose of their own regarding him, and apparently well able to enforce their purpose.
column3: And now here they were, in great numbers, evidently indifferent to what he might think, evidently determined on some purpose of their own regarding him, and apparently well able to enforce their purpose.

column2: We all thought hard just then.
column3: We all thought hard just then.

column2: It had not seemed wise to object to going with them, even if we could have; our one chance was friendliness--a civilized attitude on both sides.
column3: It had not seemed wise to object to going with them, even if we could have; our one chance was friendliness-a civilized attitude on both sides.

column2: But once inside that building, there was no knowing what these determined ladies might do to us.
column3: But once inside that building, there was no knowing what these determined ladies might do to us.

column2: Even a peaceful detention was not to our minds, and when we named it imprisonment it looked even worse.
column3: Even a peaceful detention was not to our minds, and when we named it imprisonment it looked even worse.

column2: So we made a stand, trying to make clear that we preferred the open country.
column3: So we made a stand, trying to make clear that we preferred the open country.

column2: One of them came forward with a sketch of our flier, asking by signs if we were the aerial visitors they had seen.
column3: One of them came forward with a sketch of our flier, asking by signs if we were the aerial visitors they had seen.

column2: This we admitted.
column3: This we admitted.

column2: They pointed to it again, and to the outlying country, in different directions--but we pretended we did not know where it was, and in truth we were not quite sure and gave a rather wild indication of its whereabouts.
column3: They pointed to it again, and to the outlying country, in different directions-but we pretended we did not know where it was, and in truth we were not quite sure and gave a rather wild indication of its whereabouts.

column2: Again they motioned us to advance, standing so packed about the door that there remained but the one straight path open.
column3: Again they motioned us to advance, standing so packed about the door that there remained but the one straight path open.

column2: All around us and behind they were massed solidly--there was simply nothing to do but go forward--or fight.
column3: All around us and behind they were massed solidly-there was simply nothing to do but go forward-or fight.

column2: We held a consultation.
column3: We held a consultation.

column2: I never fought with women in my life, said Terry, greatly perturbed, "but I'm not going in there.
column3: I never fought with women in my life, said Terry, greatly perturbed, "but I'm not going in there.

column2: I'm not going to be--herded in--as if we were in a cattle chute."
column3: I'm not going to be-herded in-as if we were in a cattle chute."

column2: We can't fight them, of course, Jeff urged.
column3: We can't fight them, of course, Jeff urged.

column2: They're all women, in spite of their nondescript clothes; nice women, too; good strong sensible faces.	They're all women, in spite of their nondescript clothes; nice women, too; good strong sensible faces.

column2: I guess we'll have to go in."
column3: I guess we'll have to go in."

column2: We may never get out, if we do, I told them.
column3: We may never get out, if we do, I told them.

column2: Strong and sensible, yes; but I'm not so sure about the good.	Strong and sensible, yes; but I'm not so sure about the good.

column2: Look at those faces!"
column3: Look at those faces!"

column2: They had stood at ease, waiting while we conferred together, but never relaxing their close attention.
column3: They had stood at ease, waiting while we conferred together, but never relaxing their close attention.

column2: Their attitude was not the rigid discipline of soldiers; there was no sense of compulsion about them.
column3: Their attitude was not the rigid discipline of soldiers; there was no sense of compulsion about them.

column2: Terry's term of a "vigilance committee" was highly descriptive.
column3: Terry's term of a "vigilance committee" was highly descriptive.

column2: They had just the aspect of sturdy burghers, gathered hastily to meet some common need or peril, all moved by precisely the same feelings, to the same end.
column3: They had just the aspect of sturdy burghers, gathered hastily to meet some common need or peril, all moved by precisely the same feelings, to the same end.

column2: Never, anywhere before, had I seen women of precisely this quality. Fishwives and market women might show similar strength, but it was coarse and heavy.
column3: Never, anywhere before, had I seen women of precisely this quality. Fishwives and market women might show similar strength, but it was coarse and heavy.

column2: These were merely athletic--light and powerful. College professors, teachers, writers--many women showed similar intelligence but often wore a strained nervous look, while these were as calm as cows, for all their evident intellect.
column3: These were merely athletic-light and powerful. College professors, teachers, writers-many women showed similar intelligence but often wore a strained nervous look, while these were as calm as cows, for all their evident intellect.

column2: We observed pretty closely just then, for all of us felt that it was a crucial moment.
column3: We observed pretty closely just then, for all of us felt that it was a crucial moment.

column2: The leader gave some word of command and beckoned us on, and the surrounding mass moved a step nearer.
column3: The leader gave some word of command and beckoned us on, and the surrounding mass moved a step nearer.

column2: We've got to decide quick, said Terry.
column3: We've got to decide quick, said Terry.

column2: I vote to go in, Jeff urged.
column3: I vote to go in, Jeff urged.

column2: But we were two to one against him and he loyally stood by us.
column3: But we were two to one against him and he loyally stood by us.

column2: We made one more effort to be let go, urgent, but not imploring.
column3: We made one more effort to be let go, urgent, but not imploring.

column2: In vain.
column3: In vain.

column2: Now for a rush, boys! Terry said.
column3: Now for a rush, boys! Terry said.

column2: And if we can't break 'em, I'll shoot in the air.
column3: And if we can't break 'em, I'll shoot in the air.

column3: Then we found ourselves much in the position of the suffragette trying to get to the Parliament buildings through a triple cordon of London police.

column2: The solidity of those women was something amazing.
column3: The solidity of those women was something amazing.

column3: Terry soon found that it was useless, tore himself loose for a moment, pulled his revolver, and fired upward.

column2: As they caught at it, he fired again--we heard a cry--.
column3: As they caught at it, he fired again-we heard a cry-.

column2: Instantly each of us was seized by five women, each holding arm or leg or head; we were lifted like children, straddling helpless children, and borne onward, wriggling indeed, but most ineffectually.
column3: Instantly each of us was seized by five women, each holding arm or leg or head; we were lifted like children, straddling helpless children, and borne onward, wriggling indeed, but most ineffectually.

column2: We were borne inside, struggling manfully, but held secure most womanfully, in spite of our best endeavors.
column3: We were borne inside, struggling manfully, but held secure most womanfully, in spite of our best endeavors.

column2: So carried and so held, we came into a high inner hall, gray and bare, and were brought before a majestic gray-haired woman who seemed to hold a judicial position.
column3: So carried and so held, we came into a high inner hall, gray and bare, and were brought before a majestic gray haired woman who seemed to hold a judicial position.

column2: There was some talk, not much, among them, and then suddenly there fell upon each of us at once a firm hand holding a wetted cloth before mouth and nose--an order of swimming sweetness--anesthesia.
column3: There was some talk, not much, among them, and then suddenly there fell upon each of us at once a firm hand holding a wetted cloth before mouth and nose-an order of swimming sweetness-anesthesia.
